title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't set the context correctly for nested classes
description: When attempting to create a new class using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the wizard does not correctly set the context for nested classes.
OB: When clicking the new class button with a .java file open in the editor and checking the 'Enclosing Type' field, the field is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field.
Expected result: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
